name: Dr. Moshe Vardi
description: Dr. Moshe Y. Vardi is a University Professor and the George Distinguished Service Professor in Computational Engineering at Rice University, known for his significant contributions in logic and computation.
talkTitle: How to Be an Ethical Technologist

name: Dr. Leslie Lamport
description: Dr. Leslie Lamport, a Turing Award recipient, is renowned for his pioneering work in distributed systems and as the creator of LaTeX.
talkTitle: How to Write a 21st Century Proof (AMA)

name: Dr. Noel Capon
description: Dr. Noel Capon is the R.C. Kopf Professor of International Marketing at Columbia Business School, known for his extensive work in marketing, sales, and strategic account management.
talkTitle: Managing Technology Marketing in the 21st Century

name: Dr. Barbara Liskov
description: Dr. Barbara Liskov is an Institute Professor at MIT, known for her work in programming languages and systems, including data abstraction, polymorphism, and distributed computing.
talkTitle: How Data Abstraction Changed Computing Forever

name: Dr. Nir Shavit
description: Dr. Nir Shavit is a Professor at MIT, a member of the Computer Science and Artificial Intelligence Laboratory, known for his work in multi-core computation.
talkTitle: Tissue vs. Silicone Musings on the Future of Deep Learning Hardware and Software

name: Prof. Jeffrey D. Ullman
description: Prof. Jeffrey David 'Jeff' Ullman is an esteemed computer scientist known for his substantial contributions to database theory, data mining, and software engineering. He is a Turing Award laureate, co-authoring foundational textbooks in computer science.

name: Dr. Assaf Schuster
description: Dr. Assaf Schuster is a Professor at the Technion - Israel Institute of Technology, specializing in distributed and database systems, data streams, and cloud computing.
talkTitle: AMA Style Interview with Dr. Assaf Schuster

name: Dr. Jack Dongarra
description: Dr. Jack Dongarra is a Distinguished Professor at the University of Tennessee, known for his expertise in numerical algorithms, parallel computing, and advanced-computer architectures.
talkTitle: A Not so Simple Matter of Software

name: Dr. Edward Feigenbaum
description: Dr. Edward Feigenbaum is a pioneer in artificial intelligence, known as the 'father of expert systems,' and a joint winner of the 1994 ACM Turing Award.
talkTitle: AMA Style Interview with Dr. Edward Feigenbaum

name: Dr. Nachum Dershowitz
talkTitle: AMA Style Interview with Dr. Nachum Dershowitz
